title: Comida Y Comunidad
location: Squires Student Center, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, VA
hosted_by: El Centro - Hispanic and Latinx Cultural Center
description:
Comida y Comunidad is one of El Centro‚Äôs signature programs, designed to foster belonging, cultural affirmation, and mutual support within the Virginia Tech community. The purpose of this event is to create welcoming spaces where new and returning students, faculty, staff, and community members can connect, share experiences, and build meaningful relationships.
In alignment with El Centro‚Äôs mission to affirm and celebrate the identities, cultures, and contributions of Hispanic/Latinx communities while promoting inclusion and equity for all, Comida y Comunidad serves as a vital platform for dialogue, cultural exchange, and community building. By bringing people together over food, invited speakers, and intentional conversations, this monthly gathering provides the infrastructure that sustains ongoing connections, collaboration, and a sense of belonging across campus and beyond. OPEN to ALL

title: Fermentation Around the World: Asian Countries
location: HABB1, Blacksburg, VA
description:
This is the third installment of our Fermentation Around the World series. This seminar will focus on Asian fermented foods. These
fermentation and culture events will provide a unique platform to explore the traditions and practices of food fermentation around the world. It aims to enhance participants‚Äô understanding of different food cultures, and increase awareness on the role of food culture in the development of food science and technology. This will be a seminar hosted by Phi Tau Sigma.

title: "What Does it Mean to be Catholic?" Lecture & Discussion
location: Bradley Study Center, Blacksburg, VA
description:
Many have wondered why there is such a diversity of Christian denominations. It‚Äôs a great question! Join us for our ongoing lecture series, ‚ÄúExploring the Breadth & Beauty of the Church,‚Äù as we explore many of Christianity‚Äôs various denominations. Learn from the histories, liturgies, polities, controversies, and practices of other denominations and appreciate their shared commitment to Jesus Christ as the central figure of their faith
.
We‚Äôll be hosting another lecture on December 3
exploring Catholicism (with a brief history of Advent) with guest speaker, Father Tom Yehl, Chaplain at Catholic Campus Ministries! We hope you‚Äôll join us (and come with questions)
! Desserts and hot drinks provided.

title: Let's Lock In - AANAPISI
location: Squires Student Center, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, VA
description:
DATE: Mondays starting September 15, 2025
TIME: 4:00 ‚Äì 6:00 PM EST
LOCATION: APIDA + Center (140 Squires)
Looking for a weekly boost to stay on track with your classes? Let's Lock In meets once a week ‚Äì every Monday - to give you a dedicated time and space to focus, get support, and make real progress. Join other students in a relaxed, productive environment where tutors are on hand to help with coursework, and other campus resources are just a step away. Think of it like study hall, but better: whether you're tackling tough assignments, prepping for exams, or just trying to stay organized, Let's Lock In is here to help. Drop in, get focused, and leave feeling accomplished.
Co-sponsored with the AANAPISI Initiative and the Student Success Center

hosted_by: Forestry Graduate Student Association at Virginia Tech
description:
The Forest Resources and Environmental Conservation's Graduate Student Association (FGSA) and Fish and Wildlife Graduate Student Association (FiWGSA) are co-hosting the last inter-departmental Pizza Social of the semester open to all graduate students in the College of Natural Resources and Environment (CNRE)‚Äîincluding Forest Resources and Environmental Conservation, Fish and Wildlife Conservation, Geography, and Sustainable Biomaterials.
By sharing a meal, we aim to break down barriers to participation while fostering collaboration, interdisciplinary dialogue, and resource sharing among CNRE graduate students. These recurring gatherings will provide a consistent, inclusive space that promotes well-being, builds both professional and personal connections, and strengthens our graduate student community.

title: Pizza & a Talk with Dr. Reza Tavakkoli-Moghaddam (University of Tehran)
location: Durham Hall, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, VA
hosted_by: Institute for Operations Research and the Management Science Student Chapter
description:
The INFORMS Student Chapter at Virginia Tech will host
Dr. Reza Tavakkoli-Moghaddam
from the University of Tehran for a seminar titled
‚ÄúScheduling multi-configuration last-mile delivery logistics by learning from optimization feedback and customer preferences.‚Äù
The event will be held virtually via Microsoft Teams; in-person viewing in Durham 260.
The event is open to all students and anyone¬†interested in the fields of Operations Research, Manufacturing Systems and Processes, and Management Sciences
. It's a great opportunity to engage with cutting-edge research and interact with a leading scholar in the field!

title: LAIGSA Community Lunches
location: Graduate Life Center, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, VA
hosted_by: Latin American and Iberian Graduate Students Association
description: During these lunches, Latinx graduate students and friends have the opportunity to connect and engage with one another by sharing and celebrating their cultures. These gatherings not only foster social connections but also provide a chance to exchange stories, traditions, and experiences, enriching the community as a whole. Everyone is welcome!

geocoding.formatted: Graduate Life Center, 155 Otey Street, Blacksburg, VA 24061, United States of America

title: Black Excellence in Uniform: Celebrating Service and Legacy
location: Graduate Life Center, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, VA
description:
In honor of the 100th anniversary of Black History Month, the BCO presents
Black Excellence in Uniform: Celebrating Service and Legacy
‚Äîa powerful¬† panel dedicated to educating, inspiring, and honoring the service of African American military members, both past and present. This event aims to foster meaningful dialogue between Virginia Tech cadets, students, and distinguished panelists who serve or have served in active duty or reserve roles. By showcasing the resilience, leadership, and contributions of Black service members, we seek to highlight their enduring legacy and motivate the next generation to lead with purpose, pride, and excellence.

geocoding.formatted: Graduate Life Center, 155 Otey Street, Blacksburg, VA 24061, United States of America

title: CSGC Bi-Weekly Meetings (Spring 2025)
location: Gilbert Place, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, VA
hosted_by: Computer Science Graduate Council at Virginia Tech
description: Description: CSGC officers meet every other week in this meeting to review updates from the CS department and plan how to effectively communicate these updates to the general CS graduate student body. We also make necessary arrangements for any upcoming events being organized by CSGC. While this is an internal CSGC meeting, the general CS graduate student population is welcome to attend the meeting as well.

geocoding.formatted: Blacksburg, VA, United States of America

title: Valentine's Cookie Decorating and February GBM
location: Center for Inclusivity, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, VA
description: Join RGSA for an afternoon of food and fun as we decorate cookies to celebrate the holidays! Take some time to destress from your busy schedule and eat some sweet treats while we discuss our efforts to promote graduate student wellbeing on campus. Come with any concerns you may have, ideas about initiatives, or just to relax with friends!

title: Lunar New Year celebration
location: Foxridge, Blacksburg, VA
description:
The Vietnamese Community at Virginia Tech will host a cozy
Lunar New Year Home-Cooking & Potluck Dinner
. We will share a family-style New Year meal featuring traditional Vietnamese dishes such as Banh Chung, steamed jasmine rice served with braised pork belly with eggs, crispy fried spring rolls, red sticky rice with mung beans, and Vietnamese pork sausage, along with ice and Coca-Cola. The event creates a warm ‚Äúhome away from home‚Äù where members cook, eat, and celebrate the Lunar New Year together.

title: Movie Night
location: Johnston Student Center, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, VA
description:
Take a study break and join us for
Vietnamese Movie Night
! üé•
We‚Äôll screen a fan-favorite film from Vietnam (with English subtitles), share snacks and pizza, and do a quick chat after for anyone who wants to geek out about the story, music, and culture. Whether you‚Äôre Vietnamese or just movie-curious, you‚Äôre so welcome here.
